required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Pedometers to Measure and Increase Walking Among Patients With ESRD
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Pedometers to Measure and Increase Walking Among Patients With ESRD

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized controlled trial using pedometers to increase physical activity among patients on dialysis.

primary_outcome.description: change in steps per day from pedometer

secondary_outcome.description: change in score on the Short Physical Performance Battery (0-12), higher scores indicate greater physical performance
Change in score on the Physical Function scale of the Short-Form 36 Health Survey (scale from 0-100, higher numbers indicate better physical functioning)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Activities of Daily Living Score
secondary_outcome.description: Barthel's Index of Daily Activities (Index range 0-20, higher scores indicate greater functional independence)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Symptom Burden on the Dialysis Symptoms Index
secondary_outcome.description: Dialysis symptom index (symptom burden ranges from 0 - 29 symptoms experienced)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Total Body Muscle Mass (Adjusted by Height Squared)
secondary_outcome.description: (TBMM calculated from measurements of intracellular water from bioimpedance spectrometry)

Reactive hyperemia index (RHI) using peripheral arterial tonometry. RHI is a non-invasive measure of endothelial function, measured using the EndoPAT 2000 (Itamar Medical). The pulse amplitude in the middle fingers of both hands was recorded for five minutes. A blood pressure cuff was then inflated in one arm (which did not have a vascular access in place) to at least 60 mmHg above systolic blood pressure to achieve full occlusion (minimum 200 mmHg, maximum 300 mmHg). After occlusion for 5 minutes, the cuff was deflated, and the device recorded changes in pulse amplitude for an additional 5 minutes and calculated RHI as the ratio of the post to pre occlusion amplitude of the occluded arm relative to the post to pre occlusion amplitude of the control arm, corrected for baseline vascular tone.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Short From 36 Vitality Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Short Form 36 Vitality Scale (0-100, greater values indicate increased levels of energy/decreased levels of fatigue)
Standard deviation of N-N intervals as recorded on electrocardiography waveform (ms)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Symptom Severity on Dialysis Symptoms Index
secondary_outcome.description: Symptoms range from score of 0 (Not at all bothersome) to 5 (Very Bothersome) over 29 symptoms. Score ranges from 0 - 145

arm_group.description: Patients will be given pedometers and instructions to increase physical activity based on pedometer output

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- on hemodialysis for â‰¥ 3 months
- able to walk
- able to give informed consent and willing to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- unable to walk
- unable to understand directions or give informed consent

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients recruited from 3 local San Francisco dialysis clinics
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Baseline assessment performed prior to random assignment

group.title: Pedometer
group.description: Patients will be given pedometers and weekly instructions to increase physical activity based on pedometer output over the prior week.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Recommendations for physical activity as determined by American Heart Association and American College of Sports Medicine at time of enrollment only. Otherwise, usual care.

outcome.title: Change in Total Body Muscle Mass (Adjusted by Height Squared)
outcome.description: (TBMM calculated from measurements of intracellular water from bioimpedance spectrometry)
outcome.population: Note: we were unable to obtain body composition measures from all participants at baseline and 12 weeks (Missing data from: 3 with metal implants, 1 with pacemaker, 2 with poor quality of measurement likely related to fluid shifts)

outcome.title: Change in Endothelial Function
outcome.description: Reactive hyperemia index (RHI) using peripheral arterial tonometry. RHI is a non-invasive measure of endothelial function, measured using the EndoPAT 2000 (Itamar Medical). The pulse amplitude in the middle fingers of both hands was recorded for five minutes. A blood pressure cuff was then inflated in one arm (which did not have a vascular access in place) to at least 60 mmHg above systolic blood pressure to achieve full occlusion (minimum 200 mmHg, maximum 300 mmHg). After occlusion for 5 minutes, the cuff was deflated, and the device recorded changes in pulse amplitude for an additional 5 minutes and calculated RHI as the ratio of the post to pre occlusion amplitude of the occluded arm relative to the post to pre occlusion amplitude of the control arm, corrected for baseline vascular tone.

measure.title: Change in Endothelial Function
measure.description: Reactive hyperemia index (RHI) using peripheral arterial tonometry. RHI is a non-invasive measure of endothelial function, measured using the EndoPAT 2000 (Itamar Medical). The pulse amplitude in the middle fingers of both hands was recorded for five minutes. A blood pressure cuff was then inflated in one arm (which did not have a vascular access in place) to at least 60 mmHg above systolic blood pressure to achieve full occlusion (minimum 200 mmHg, maximum 300 mmHg). After occlusion for 5 minutes, the cuff was deflated, and the device recorded changes in pulse amplitude for an additional 5 minutes and calculated RHI as the ratio of the post to pre occlusion amplitude of the occluded arm relative to the post to pre occlusion amplitude of the control arm, corrected for baseline vascular tone.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Outcomes reported are median change within groups with 95% confidence interval. Primary analysis is difference in change between groups using linear mixed modeling. Participants were selected only from dialysis clinics in Northern California.
